items.title: Rams QB Matthew Stafford's season could end up ranking among the best in NFL history
items.summary: Matthew Stafford is having one of the best statistical seasons in NFL history.  The 37-year-old quarterback has thrown 27 touchdowns since his most recent interception in Week 3.  Overall, he has 2,830 yards passing, 30 TDs, 2 interceptions and a 113.7 passer rating while leading the Los Angeles Rams to a 9-2 record and the current No. 1 seed in the NFC.

items.title: Colts’ Jones, Steichen share blame for late offensive ineptitude in tough OT road loss to Chiefs
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts were up 20-9 against the Kansas City Chiefs, and their defense had just recovered a timely Kareem Hunt fumble with 14:48 left in the 4th quarter near their own 17-yard line—thwarting yet another potential KC touchdown scoring drive. It appeared as though the Colts were poised to deny Patrick Mahomes yet another […]

items.title: Colts offense humbled in Kansas City, chance for learning experience
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts‘ offense began the season on a historic pace. Head coach Shane Steichen had seemingly resurrected quarterback Daniel Jones, running back Jonathan Taylor kick-started his MVP campaign, and the offensive line was mauling defensive fronts at will. Through seven weeks, the Colts’ offense was the most efficient offense by points per drive this […]

items.title: Colts’ offense disappeared in OT loss to Chiefs: ’Not up to our standards’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Go ahead, blame the defense all you want. And there’s ample evidence. It failed to protect an 11-point fourth-quarter lead. It allowed Patrick Mahomes to spin his legendary late magic. The two-time MVP and three-time Super Bowl champion directed desperate Kansas City to Harrison Butker’s 25-yard field goal as time expired in regulation [...]

items.title: AFC Playoff Picture: Indianapolis Colts fall further behind AFC lead with loss
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts lost in Week 12 and the New England Patriots won, meaning Indy is even further away from regaining the top spot in the conference they lost on their bye. The Denver Broncos are on the bye and remain second. The Los Angeles Chargers also stay in their spot on the bye. The […]

items.title: Colts head coach Shane Steichen on offensive issues in Week 12 loss to Chiefs: 'It starts with me'

items.title: Colts squander late lead in OT loss to Chiefs
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts fell apart late in Sunday’s 23-20 overtime loss as quarterback Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs erased an 11-point deficit to storm back in stunning fashion at Arrowhead Stadium.  The Chiefs ran 91 offensive plays, compared to the Colts limited to just 50 plays. Kansas City (6-5) outgained Indianapolis 228-18 over […]

items.title: Colts fail to outlast the Chiefs, fall 23-20 in Kansas City

After the Colts failed to score on their first possession, Laiatu Latu intercepted a Mahomes pass deep in Chiefs territory to set [...]

items.title: Charvarius Ward thought career might be over after concussion, but now ‘I feel like me again. I feel like Mooney’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Charvarius Ward didn’t need to see the video detailing events that left him with a concussion and lingering, serious symptoms that had him questioning whether he would ever play again. “I experienced it,’’ the Indianapolis Colts’ veteran cornerback said Friday. Ward called his collision with teammate Drew Ogletree freaky while each was going [...]

items.title: Colts CB Charvarius Ward Sr. on return from concussion: 'I feel like me again'
items.summary: Charvarius Ward Sr. cleared concussion protocol this week and is line to return against the Kansas City Chiefs in his first game since sustaining a concussion he described as "scary" prior to the Colts' Week 6 win over the Arizona Cardinals.

items.title: Daniel Jones, Charvarius Ward full go for Colts’ trip to Kansas City
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The quarterback and cornerback are good to go. As the Indianapolis Colts eye Sunday’s showdown with the Kansas City Chiefs in Arrowhead Stadium, they’ll have the services of Daniel Jones and Charvarius Ward. Jones was a full participant Friday’s practice after being limited Thursday when he experienced discomfort with his fibula. The Colts [...]

items.title: Despite expanding game, the superpower of Colts’ Alec Pierce is getting deep
